  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: Utilities to adjust layout policies.

  9#ifndef VSIP_OPT_ADJUST_LAYOUT_HPP
 10#define VSIP_OPT_ADJUST_LAYOUT_HPP
 11
 12#include <vsip/core/layout.hpp>
 13
 14namespace vsip
 15{
 16namespace impl
 17{
 18
 19/// Adjust a type.  If a preferred type is given, use that.  Otherwise
 20/// if 'Any_type' is given, use the actual type.
 21///
 22/// Provides:
 23///  - type  - typedef with the adjusted type.
 24///  - equiv - bool set to true if the preferred and actual types
 25///            were equivalent (either the same, or preferred was
 26///            'Any_type').
 27template <typename PreferredT,
 28	  typename ActualT>
 29struct Adjust_type
 30{
 31  typedef PreferredT type;
 32  static bool const equiv = false;
 33};
 34
 35template <typename ActualT>
 36struct Adjust_type<Any_type, ActualT>
 37{
 38  typedef ActualT type;
 39  static bool const equiv = true;
 40};
 41
 42template <typename SameT>
 43struct Adjust_type<SameT, SameT>
 44{
 45  typedef SameT type;
 46  static bool const equiv = true;
 47};
 48
 49
 50
 51/// Variant of Adjust_type for adjusting pack_type's.
 52///
 53/// In particular, adjusts Stride_unknown pack types to something that
 54/// can be used to allocate a block.
 55template <typename PreferredT,
 56	  typename ActualT>
 57struct Adjust_pack_type
 58  : Adjust_type<PreferredT, ActualT>
 59{};
 60
 61template <>
 62struct Adjust_pack_type<Any_type, Stride_unknown>
 63{
 64  typedef Stride_unit_dense type;
 65  static bool const equiv = true;
 66};
 67
 68
 69
 70/// Variant of Adjust_type for adjusting complex_type's.
 71///
 72/// Uses the value type T to determine when the complex_type matters.
 73/// In particular, for non-complex value types, the complex_type is
 74/// not applicable.
 75template <typename T,
 76	  typename PreferredT,
 77	  typename ActualT>
 78struct Adjust_complex_type
 79{
 80  typedef ActualT type;
 81  static bool const equiv = true;
 82};
 83
 84template <typename T,
 85	  typename PreferredT,
 86	  typename ActualT>
 87struct Adjust_complex_type<complex<T>, PreferredT, ActualT>
 88  : Adjust_type<PreferredT, ActualT>
 89{};
 90
 91
 92
 93/// Adjust an actual layout policy against a required layout policy.
 94///
 95/// The resulting layout takes its values from the required layout
 96/// where it specifies a value, or from the actual layout when the
 97/// required layout specifies 'Any_type'.
 98template <typename T,
 99	  typename RequiredLP,
100	  typename ActualLP>
101struct Adjust_layout
102{
103  static dimension_type const dim = RequiredLP::dim;
104
105  typedef typename RequiredLP::order_type   req_order_t;
106  typedef typename RequiredLP::pack_type    req_pack_t;
107  typedef typename RequiredLP::complex_type req_complex_t;
108
109  typedef typename ActualLP::order_type     act_order_t;
110  typedef typename ActualLP::pack_type      act_pack_t;
111  typedef typename ActualLP::complex_type   act_complex_t;
112
113  typedef typename Adjust_type<req_order_t,     act_order_t>::type order_type;
114  typedef typename Adjust_pack_type<req_pack_t, act_pack_t>::type  pack_type;
115
116  typedef typename Adjust_complex_type<T, req_complex_t, act_complex_t>::type
117		complex_type;
118
119  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> type;
120};
121
122
123
124template <dimension_type NewDim,
125	  typename       LP>
126struct Adjust_layout_dim
127{
128  typedef typename LP::order_type     order_type;
129  typedef typename LP::pack_type      pack_type;
130  typedef typename LP::complex_type   complex_type;
131
132  typedef Layout<NewDim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> type;
133};
134
135
136
137template <typename NewPackType,
138	  typename LP>
139struct Adjust_layout_pack
140{
141  typedef typename LP::order_type     order_type;
142  typedef typename LP::pack_type      pack_type;
143  typedef typename LP::complex_type   complex_type;
144
145  typedef Layout<LP::dim, order_type, NewPackType, complex_type> type;
146};
147
148
149
150template <typename NewComplexType,
151	  typename LP>
152struct Adjust_layout_complex
153{
154  typedef typename LP::order_type     order_type;
155  typedef typename LP::pack_type      pack_type;
156
157  typedef Layout<LP::dim, order_type, pack_type, NewComplexType> type;
158};
159
160
161
162/// Determine if an given layout policy is compatible with a required
163/// layout policy.
164///
165/// The value_type 'T' is used to determine when differences between
166/// complex_type matter.
167template <typename T,
168	  typename RequiredLP,
169	  typename ActualLP>
170struct Is_layout_compatible
171{
172  typedef typename RequiredLP::order_type   req_order_type;
173  typedef typename RequiredLP::pack_type    req_pack_type;
174  typedef typename RequiredLP::complex_type req_complex_type;
175
176  typedef typename ActualLP::order_type     act_order_type;
177  typedef typename ActualLP::pack_type      act_pack_type;
178  typedef typename ActualLP::complex_type   act_complex_type;
179
180  static bool const value =
181    RequiredLP::dim == ActualLP::dim                     &&
182    Adjust_type<           req_order_type,   act_order_type>::equiv &&
183    Adjust_pack_type<      req_pack_type,    act_pack_type>::equiv  &&
184    Adjust_complex_type<T, req_complex_type, act_complex_type>::equiv;
185};
186
187} // namespace vsip::impl
188} // namespace vsip

190#endif
